title: Burnside's theorem
summary: In mathematics, Burnside's theorem in group theory states that if G is a finite group of order p a q b {\displaystyle p^{a}q^{b}} where p and q are prime numbers, and a and b are non-negative integers, then G is solvable. Hence each non-Abelian finite simple group has order divisible by at least three distinct primes.
